reviewText: Does anyone else see the 'Auntie Mame' references in this movie? or is it just me? Either way, I found it delightfully funny, campy, and sweet. It may not win any awards for best 'Gay' themed movie of the year, but it certainly made me laugh, and is that what comedys are supposed to do?
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: This movie was so cute it made my teeth rot. It reminds you that there are really fantastic people in this world.
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: I thought this movie was really cute and not trashy or stereotypical like a lot of gay movies can be.  Definitely worth a watch!
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: although i loved the eye candy i foundjoanne mcgee & carol goans an absolute hoot had tears rolling down all the way through
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: A very cute, over-the-top comedy with a subtle message of acceptance and unconditional love. You Should Meet My Son is a lighthearted movie, with a much deeper, underlying moral. I loved the shift in the mother's behavior from beginning to end. Watching her go from denial over her son's sexuality, to begrudging acceptance, and then finally fully embracing him as is was a beautiful thing. We should all be so lucky as to have a parent who can cast aside a lifetime's worth of ingrained beliefs and prejudices in order to encourage and support their child.
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: I hope this is a comedy, because the premise and outcome are all fitted into a very funny plot. This is not one of those one and a half star gay movies.
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: I pre-ordered this directly from the Writer/Producer a while back, and received it about a month ago.  I've already watched it 4 times.  This is a really great movie; it's not only funny and a bit over the top, but also has an important message to present: Be who you are and love life.  "Baby, I was born this way!"  Very Highly Recommended.
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: The drag queens here, "Fantasia", "Salsa Rojah", and company are a riot!  Also, the male stripper, Chase, is adorable.  I wish the film had focused more on developing a relationship between him and the lead actor, "Brian", near the end of the movie.While I thought the mother and aunt overacted a bit, they really carried the film and did a fine job of infiltrating the gay scene and bringing the story to a nice ending all about unconditional familial love and acceptance.
summary: Making Light of the Religious Right
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: I really enjoyed this movie, even though it is obviously very low budget and some of the portrayals were cliche'.  But it was a lot of fun, and it had a happy ending.  Oddly enough, the one scene between the mother and her son where it became very serious was quite moving to me, enough that it got me a little teary-eyed.  They played the scene well, and then it was back to the fun.  I liked the movies so well that I bought it.  I highly recommend this movie if you are looking for a good, funny, gay movie.
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: it was funny caring and maybe not a situation most gays would find themselves in but maybe a desirable one!
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: Brian and his "roommate" Dennis have endured years of southern Sunday dinners with Brian's widowed mother, Mae, and his Aunt Rose.  Both of the women are  equally clueless about the fact that they are a gay couple, and constantly invite along a single woman for Brian to meet.  When Dennis and Brian break up, Brian shows up for dinner alone, explaining his "roommate" found his own place, and is further upset when that evening's female guest figures him out in a matter of minutes. Mae and Rose overhear her remark that Brian is gay, and, after some soul searching, they decide to find a new boyfriend for him.  They go to a local gay bar, and talk a go-go boy into coming for Sunday dinner.  When Brian brings along a guest they were not expecting, luckily Mae and Rose have other guests who come to the rescue.This is a madcap, over-the-top comedy, kind of in the same vein as "Sordid Lives," complete with Southern accents that come and go. There are liberal doses of camp and stereotypes, drag queens, internet hook-up sites, ageist twinks, leather people, bible thumping, an ex-gay conversion center (complete with shock therapy), and an overall implausible premise that you want to believe anyway, because it is just so darned much fun.  Positive depictions of gay youth, and lessons to parents who don't accept their gay or lesbian children, are valuable parts of the story.  Written/directed and produced by Keith Hartman, best known for several (equally "over-the-top") gay novels, on a tiny budget that he put to excellent use (Many of the extras in the bar scene are actually crew members.)  Unrated, but would be PG for light sexual content. DVD extras listed include commentaries by Hartman (which doesn't work on my retail DVD) or by the actresses who played the two women, a go-go boy video, deleted scene, trailer and cast/crew profiles.  Won several gay film festival awards with its infectious positive humor.  I give it four stars out of five.
summary: A bit over-the-top, with stereotypes galore, but too much fun to miss!
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: Very, very funny, but maybe to stereotypical for my tastes. Loved it when the mom and aunt changed. Loved the story. Maybe I just imagine it could be true.
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: I enjoyed this movie very much. Well done in a genre that doesn't get much attention. Acting was solid and script was crisp (for the most part).
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: I love this movie, I has a great Message about being who you are and not what society says you should be.
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: O.k.,This was a fun movie to watch, some nice eye candy.The quick transformation of the mother and aunt is a littlehard to believe, but overall I did not regret renting this film.
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: Hilarious film about a confused family situation. Gay son tries to hide his orientation in order to give his mom what she wants, a happy hetero marriage with children. The plots and subplots unravel in very funny ways. Most of the characters are stereotypes and for a good reason as the film carries a message about respect, honesty and acceptance. It's a keeper!
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: This movie was funny and enjoyable, just loved the cast of characters and the movie played well, with lots of laughs. Watched it a few times and still laugh through it. Its a good movie.
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: This movie started out very slow - and with the odd stilted acting that you see on the stage, very theatrical, and in the specific style you might see at an off-Broadway show.  After getting over the over the top performances of the Southern mother and her sister, the sort-of unbelievable naivete that they exhibit going online to see what Manhunt is about and going to their town's gay bar, I started to actually like the movie.It is most certainly NOT of the same standard as a movie like Trick, but it is good.  The parts that start to bring the drag queens and muscle-leather couple and the young 16 yr old gay neighbor kid together start to feel even more like Spanish Golden Age Theater or Oscar Wilde style of surprise-shock of unexpected conversations and interactions.The end of the movie was tender, showing the total love and support the mother has always had, and the dreams she has for his happiness.  If you're expecting a high-gloss film with very high movie-type standards, this is not for you.  If you are more relaxed about those expectations, then you should enjoy the film as much as I ended up enjoying it.
summary: Why do all gay movies seem like they were written for the stage?
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: Director/writer Keith Hartman's charming comedy, about a mother's unconditional love for her gay son, quickly became an award-winning favorite at several gay film festivals. And it's easy to see why.At first, Southern mama Mae (Joanne McGee) is horrified to learn that her beloved only son Brian (Stewart Carrico) is "you know"...gay. Mae and Brian haven't been communicating at all. Despite the fact that he's had a five year relationship with his "room-mate" Dennis (Brett Holland) , Brian can't bear to tell her he's gay, for fear she'll need CPR. And if he can't tell her he's gay, he can't tell her he is heartbroken after Dennis leaves him. Mae learns the truth after her spinster sister Rose (Carol Goans) completes a gay quiz in "Glamour"  magazine. After some over-the-top wailing ("I should never have let Brian watch "The Wizard Of Oz"...it has Judy Garland") and a visit to an "ex-gay" church program, Mae and Rose decide they love Brian just the way he is. From then on, they are women on a mission...to find Brian Mr. Right.It is hard to believe that Mae and Rose are as clueless as they initially are... not only about Brian, but about everything! These women have never heard of the Internet. And they haven't been downtown in twenty years. Yet, the scenes of Rose and Mae's first day on the Internet and first night of "man-hunting" at a gay bar are absolutely hilarious. Rose takes a wrong turn at the gay bar and drag-queen Salsa (Matt Palazzolo) exclaims "Oh Grandma, "The Sound Of Music" look is so over!", just before giving her a mini-makeover.In this breezy 85 minute movie, the characters undergo some drastic and hasty behavioral changes. The movie itself also makes a rather dizzy transition from funny comedy to full-on farce in the vein of "Auntie Mame."  But, on the whole, the overall movie works. McGee and Goans give especially endearing performances. It also doesn't hurt that Stewart Carrico is gorgeous and easy on the eyes. The equally dreamy Steve Snyder plays Chase, the guy you  WISH Brian will get a clue about and hurry up and hook up with. The diverting ensemble cast also includes Ginger Pullman, Acquah Dansoh, Chris Nolan and Leif Holt.Keith Hartman's strength as a director/writer is that he goes for honest laughs instead of cheap ones. The humor is never at the expense of the characters. We laugh with the characters, but never at them. Hartman knows there must be humanity underneath farce in order for farce to work. The most touching moment occurs late in the film when Mae tells Brian, "I want you to be happy... and if you're not happy in this world, I will change the world. But I will not have the world change you!" That is the kind of unconditional,  loving response every gay and lesbian individual hopes to receive from their parents, friends, loved ones, etc., but seldom do. "My Son" presents the world as it should be, instead of how it is.  In this case, a farce-fantasy  is not a bad thing at all. The film offers hope and, with its head and heart in exactly the right place, is especially heartwarming.
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: This is such a simple yet cute story. I think it's unfair some of the criticisms of the small DVD movies. The acting is not as bad as some critics make them out to be, but, truth be told, they don't have the budget to get 'the best' if you will...but the tell great stories that a LOT of us didn't have the opportunity to be told when living a false life. Great story with many layers. I thoroughly enjoyed!!!
summary: I Wanted To Meet Him AND His Mom!
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: You Should Meet My Son is one of the funniest and nicest gay comedy I have recently seen, probably the best of 2011. I'm quite surprise this movie was not more on the word of mouth of my friends, since it's not easy to do satira on gay themes with such touch of elegance. True, the storyline is excessive, but that is what satira is.Brian is 30 years old and in the closet, or at least he is when he goes to friday dinner to his mother's home. He has a steady relationship with Dennis, who pretends to be his roommate. Brian's mother, Mae, is so out of the real world that she doesn't even consider the idea his son is gay until one of the candidate girl she brought to him doesn't enlighting her.Here Mae's character, so as that of her sister Rose, turn into wonderful when they set out to find Brian the perfect husband, above all when his relationship with Dennis ends up in a bad way.This is truly a movie about Mae and Rose more than Brian. I really like how Mae, not only understands what is better for his son Brian, but also tries to help other young boys, like she probably would have done for her son if he had the courage to tell her.The supporting characters are all pretty good, I love the leather-couple, and Chase, the chosen husband, is cute with that big brownie eyes, and strange to say, he is even better when he is dressed ;-)Aside from the jokes, this is a movie whose only fault is to try to do its best with the little budget it had. The plot is very good, the actors above the average, and the few sets carefully chosen. Sure, it shows the limited budget, but most of the time you forget it, involved as you are in the adventures of two middle-age women in search of true love... for their dear boy.
summary: You Should Meet My Son! (2010) directed by Keith Hartman
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: It's a sweet and entertaining idea for a movie in a weak production. The acting is "community theater" level and serviceable.The point of view is flawed. We start with  the son's point of view, then a little late in we're switched to his mother and aunt's pov.  The actor playing the son is better than the rest so he steals the scenes he's in, perhaps that's the issue. The film gives us the adventures of the mom and her sister. Unbeknownst to son, they've learned he is gay. They quickly transition from firmly against to full acceptance then set off to find him a boyfriend to replace the one he's just lost. It all appears to happen in the span of a few days, which is unreasonable for the outcomes.I thought the premise, many segments and a lot of the dialogue were entertaining, even touching. The moms zany character is infectious and the theme that over all she loves her son and wants to find him happiness is engaging. I'd actually love to see these characters and this plot, even some of the script after some skilled filmmaking.
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: The film "You should meet my Son" is a very low budgeted little film that many times is a very "Over the top" film with shades of "Auntie Mame" thrown in.  That said, I found myself laughing many times at the wild antics on the screen by all of the very good actors involved.  I particularly enjoyed the" in need of someone to love" son--played wonderfully and believably by Stewart Carrico.  He superbly plays a son "in shock" when his very conservative mom starts "match making" him with other gay men after trying very hard to match him with the "right" girl. In the process of finding a man for her son, she and her repressed sister meet some very "interesting" people and find some friends for themselves.  It's a fun "romp" for all.Combined with a very amusing script and good direction, this film will make for a very fun evening. There is no violence, sex, nudity or much bad lanuage; therefore, anyone can enjoy this very funny "little" movie.
summary: Over the top but loads of fun
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: A ridiculous plot which is extremely well executed.  The movie is great fun, and very sweet.  It is a most enjoyable movie.
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: In spite of the good reviews, I really didn't have high hopes for this movie, because I thought the cover picture looked a little cheesy.  I'm so glad I gave it a try.  It was very enjoyable!  Sweet, funny, touching.  Sure, it's a little over the top, but that is part of the charm.  The characters were very endearing.  It was wonderful to watch a conservative mother open her heart and mind to people who were so obviously not part of her normal world, just to help her son have a happier life.  Very, very good, and well worth watching again and again.  One of the best gay movies I've seen in a while.
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: A fun little film about a mom's quest to find a nice guy for her gay son. The mom's heart is in the right place and silly mayhem unfolds.Maybe a good rental for people who only want EPIC films in their private library...but a great little film which takes viewers on a fun adventure....none the less.
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: You Should Meet My Son is a solid indie film that is funny.  The acting was great.  I wish there was more to the story.  I wanted to see where the relationship with Chase and Brian goes.
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: This is a great movie about finding true love, with the help of your family.  It is a riot.  I love the part when the mother and auntie are surfing the internet looking for the perfect guy and don't understand the language.  This will make you chuckle for days.  I have watched it 5 times and plan to watch it with friends so we can all have a good laugh.
summary: This is such a great movie, it puts a smile on my face.
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: I thought this was a delightful little ol' film. It's the Sordid Lives married Auntie Mame and had a gay baby on a modest budget.
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: This movie was a bit over the top with it's humor, but I think it was necessary to counter the hard points that were incorporated into the story line. It will leave you laughing, if not for joy, but for the complete silliness of the whole thing.
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: The only explanation for all the three and four star reviews is the director must have a lot of friends!  This is truly abysmal - like some gay amateur theatre improv exercise circa 1975.  The plot is painfully dumb, the characters defy human logic at every turn and the acting is beyond bad, but sadly not entertainingly so.  You've been warned!
summary: How did this even get made?!!!!
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: This movie was very funny, it is entertaining all he way through. There are several twists and surprises scattered throughout the movie to keep your interest all the way to the end. I highly recommend it as a part of your DVD collection.
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: Was a little skeptical at first, but after watching it that all changed. A little campy at times, but this camp just adds to the charm of the movie. I'll consider purchasing this one.
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: Very entertaining movie where a mother who's been trying to fix her son up with girls, finds out her son is gay and goes on a search to find him a companion.  Had funny parts in it like going to a gay go go bar and the drag queens.
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: If non-stop, shrieking fake Southern accents, garish stereotypes, and humor as subtle as being hit in the head with a cast iron frying pan send you rolling in the aisles, then you will probably love this movie. I was raised in a subtler, less obnoxious South than the one celebrated here, and I am too happy being gay to relate to this hysteria, so I hated it.But any gay movie that celebrates being gay deserves some support, so I gave it two stars just for having its heart in the right place. God bless it, its makers, and anybody who can enjoy it.
summary: Shrill and tiresome, but its heart is in the right place
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: "You Should Meet My Son" is a fun-filled romp, laden with enough chuckles and smiles and endearing, stereotypical silliness -- along with some wistful fantasy fodder in the form of a hot disco dancer -- to make it more than worthwhile for those not in search of melodrama or profundity.Be prepared, however, to overlook some of its obvious, almost cloying contrivances.
summary: Popcorn for the Mind -- but Loads of Fun Nonetheless!
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewerName: John Frame "There Is No Substitute For Equality"
reviewText: True to the DVD cover art, "You Should Meet My Son" doesn't masquerade as being anything other than light and fun entertainment, but it is also honest and passionate. In brief, a young gay man has tried far too hard to keep his sexuality secret from his mother and aunt - to the point where his partner leaves for greener pastures. Brian's mother and her sister discover the big gay truth and quickly dispense with their culturally acquired bigotry. They then set out on a mission to find heartbroken Brian a suitable gay male partner - taking a crash course in gay community diversity and etiquette in the process. However, thankfully, things are not that simple (and only marginally overladen with stereotypes).Keith Hartman does a wonderful job with the script - keeping things fresh, lively  and relevant. Hartman also ought to take a deep bow as director in his first feature film - and he happily gives  plenty of due credit to the talented crew he assembled to make this film look consistently beautiful and interesting, and to also sound wonderful (especially, as we learn from the commentary tracks, in quite challenging circumstances).The editing is particularly praiseworthy - my award goes to Donna Matthewson. The slightly surreal colours remind me very much of the UK original 1999 Queer As Folk series (NB: the cinematrogaphic quality is much better in this film - no doubt due in part to the advancements in digital technology).The DVD extras are valuable - including Keith's short films in opposition to Proposition 8 (which excluded same sex couples from legal marriage in California). The only (minor) trouble I had with the DVD was in getting the correct commentary track to play - on two different brand players I could only get the one with the actors to work from the "extras" menu (no matter what selection I made), but by using the "audio" select on the remote I could also choose to hear the commentary by the writer/director and editor.I recommend that anyone who likes the film (surely that's anyone who sees it) should also take the time to watch the film with each of the two commentary tracks - and then watch the film again with the original soundtrack. Your appreciation is significantly amplified, making "You Should Meet My Son" a film which you're likely to recommend to all your family and friends, and to enjoy re-watching  with them any number of times. An excellent original music soundtrack adds further lustre.The cast all do a fine job and they must be very proud of the final edit. It's no surprise that this has been an award winner at gay and lesbian film festivals.
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: I did not read much about this movie before I buy because I am collecting gay movies to study them. But it was a very nice surprise. It is fun, not very Hollywood movie, not very professional, but it is a great movie. It is very close to what is happening right now in many families not only in United States. It shows especially how some gay people do not go out because they do believe that the family will die after that. The movie shows how important it to have a good conversation with those who we love to explain to them how do we feel about ourselves.  I do recommend this movie to those who are afraid to talk about sexuality and gay diversity.
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: Such a charming little movie. I laughed so hard I almost cried, and then was brought to tears by a touching scene in the next moment. And how wonderful that this "gay" movie actually focuses on the mother and aunt. Not perfect by any means -- some of the scenes take a huge leap of faith to follow the story -- but that only adds to the delight. Rent this one!
summary: Watched it twice during my rental period
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: ......think I just dated myself.  I meant to say:  What a "BLAST!"  What's that you're saying....I'm still talk'n like an old guy.  Okay, okay....just whisper it to me.  Ah...now I get it:  What a "KICK-ASS!" pair these two ladies are.And I obviously agree with you.  This Mom and this Aunt are all those Capital letters above....rolled up together (and even more so, aren't they).  What Gay youngster, thrown out on the streets of this world, wouldn't give for a mother and father, or any family member, like either Momma Mae or Auntie Rose?  (They really deserve at least a half-Star, extra)((  POSSIBLE LIGHT SPOILERS AHEAD  ))Since you've probably already seen other comments / reviews outlining this story, let me only add that it is, basically, just the story of a Gay young man who's afraid to Come Out to the family.  Yet, what makes this one pretty special is the verve.....the life.....the acceptance that just pours off the screen, and out over us, from these two marvelous ladies.Oh, and are there ANY bases not covered by first-time, feature length Director, Keith Hartman?  (If I miss any of the important themes he provides, please just add them in a "Comment" following this review).  Hmm...let's see now.....I recall that they include:1 - Loss of the long-time boyfriend (don't worry...he doesn't die).2 - Discovery by family of someone's "abnormal" sexual orientation (a Big 6 on the Kinsey Scale).3 - Struggle over Acceptance.4 - Search for a suitable replacement, needed due to Item 1, above.  (Doesn't hurt he's a gorgeously hunky go-go dancer, wearing tight briefs)5 - Attempt by a "Kinsey 6" at a Heterosexual lifestyle.6 - Consideration of enrollment in a Gay Conversion Therapy program.7 - Time spent in cleaning up all the Holy Mess....created by Items 1 thru 6, above.8 - THE ENDPS--(It's a lot of Fun + Laughs----You'll enjoy it)****
summary: "You Should Meet My Mom & Auntie" ..... (What a "HOOT!"....Oh, wait, I......
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: I thought this was a good movie. It wasn't slow or boring. It made you laugh or turn you on at the right time.
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: This was a really funny film that was also very uplifting, positive, and heartwarming.  It's not going to win any oscars (the acting is a bit over the top in places) but it's definitely worth renting and even having in your gay movie collection.  The mom and aunt are freekin hilarious.  Check it out, you won't be sorry.
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: So I agree with some of the negative comments on this film, but it is difficult to deny the positive ones as well.  It is very overdone, and the acting isn't topnotch, however the reason this movie had appeal for me, is because you really do start to look at most of the characters and say- I wouldn't mind having these people as friends..  The mother's support for her son is also non-typical, but it is also something more mothers could aspire to, especially with current problems facing their lgbt children.
summary: Extremely silly, exaggerated, and yet sweet...
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: I must say, I was a little skeptical about buying this movie on DVD, but now that I have watched it I definitely recommend this movie! :) It is funny, beautiful, tender, serious yet not to ferocious and a wonderful movie of what Love really is, that is transcends hate and insecurity.
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: This movie is a lot of fun and I laughed out loud many times. There is so much here about community and acceptance. One man's struggle to live his life without hurting the ones he loves gets a real surprise when they reconcile to the fact that he's gay and vow to help him find the perfect man to share his life. All round enjoyable film! I think you'll laugh as hard as I did:)
summary: A great laugh and some very poignant moments
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: although it was a bit better than "eating out: drama camp" and a little bit funnier, the two ladies depicted in this movie are just too UNBELIEVABLE.
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: This movie is so fun and real it could take place anywhere USA. A mom who loves her only child has found out he is gay and tries to get over her own feelings about the issue and help her son find a husband. The supprting role of the sister is extremely hilarious as is the supporting cast!!
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: If you love Auntie Mame with Rosalind Russell, you'll appreciate the loving homage that this indie pays to a scene in that  marvelous 1958 film.  This movie's denouement is a wonderful reinterpretation that classic scene during which Mame Dennis fantastically derails the engagement of her beloved Patrick Dennis to the ghastly Gloria Upson.  Only in this film, the betrothal derailment is accomplished not with pickled rattlesnake and flaming cocktails, but with flaming drag glamazons and a nude portrait of George Herbert Walker Bush.  No. Joke.While this film is set in Birmingham, AL, the actors' accents were inconsistent.  I know this fact because I grew up in Alabama.  The actors portraying the aunt and mother gave good approximations of the accents of educated, upper-middle-class, Alabama females of (about) age 60.  The son and the rest of the cast were less spot-on.In summary, I laughed aloud, several times.  What more could you want on a Christmas afternoon?
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: No matter what these 4 star reviews on Amazon say this film is very poorly made and seems like a high school play.  Harsh lighting, sound that that is not mixed necessitating adjusting the volume over and over. Strident delivery from the actresses playing the mother and aunt. A truly embarssing scene in a gay bar that is played against one wall as if there really was no set. And the ending sequence was just a confusing mish mash with everything shot from one angle in the livingroom like a tableau or stage play. In fact in the final moment between the mother and son she literally escorts him downstage closer to the camera to play their final moments. Very odd. In fact lots of scenes were played out with no coverage--just a single shot with two or three characters standing and reciting their lines.  I can only assume that friends of the director or the production are posting these extremely misleading complimentary reviews.  The director touts this as a "micro-budget movie".  Indeed it is.  A lamentable product of an unfortunate phase in indie films.
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: Jokingly focuses in family dynamic. You need to think why a couple of times but it gets to the point w/o offending
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: After having seen far too many gay independent movies that are promised/reviewed as being worthwhile (and finding out the hard way they're mostly not--for example most recently, "Is It Just Me?"), it's a relief to finally come across one that is genuinely wonderful.  I won't beat around the bush:  I loved "You Should Meet My Son."  It goes a long way towards making up for all the bad independent gay movies I've seen along the way.  It's a movie with a very big heart, and it's both funny and touching.  For whatever shortcomings there may be in the acting or script, they're largely irrelevant in the final analysis because the end result is so much greater than the sum of the parts.  It's not a perfect movie, but even still, it's extremely affirming, embracing, and rather touching.  I don't doubt this is a movie I will want to see again more than once in the future.  Congratulations to Keith Hartman (the writer/director) for a job well done.  Also, among the extras on the DVD are earlier short videos that Hartman made.  My favorite of the lot is "The Defenders" from 2009--it's fantastic and really funny, while also getting the point across rather potently.  You can also view "The Defenders" free on on YouTube.
summary: A touching and funny little gem well worth seeing
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: You sould llike this one.The way his MOM is tring to set up on dates.The only thing is Well you will just have to see it to like it.
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: Don't believe the reviews here. The reviews have to be a scam to get you to watch because this movie is awful. Over-acted and over-wrought!  The movie's first half-hour showed promise but then the movie quickly fell apart once the mother and her sister visited a gay club.  The plot stalled and the story became predictable and dull. Once the sister gets made over in a bathroom by 2 drag queens, (while the mother inexplicably doesn't even seem fazed by her sister's prolonged absence in an unfamiliar place), I stopped watching. I have to comment on a glaring inconsistency.  In the beginning, there is a parade of different girls invited over to dinner, representing all the times that the mother and the aunt had tried in vain to do some match-making for the son (who was secretly gay). The clothing for the mother, aunt and the different girls always changes from one attempt to another. With each attempt, they show the son and his boyfriend seated at the table. However, in error, their clothing never changes. It should have. Speaking of changes, this film needed a much, much better production team!
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: The movie was funny in so many ways and I liked it.I found it funny that the mother was always trying to help her son.Fairly good comedy.
summary: Kinda funny in it`s on way
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: At long last  we have a gay film that is  beautifully photographed  and not a shakey camera in site (very very rare for most gay films).It doesn't pretend to be anything original, story wise and may even be silly at times but at least the writers know how to write comedy ( something rare for USA films).The film is one continuous  laugh after another and the cast are superb.When was the last time you saw a gay film where  they actually had an ensemble of very talented  people  who could act?. If you are feeling down in the dumps then see this great film as it is  a great feel good film that you  will want to see over and over again.The entire  cast and crew must be proud of their achievment in giving us  such a fantastic comedy.I have been so disappointed with gay movies for a long time.Nice to know that this film gives me faith in the fact that  they  can make a great  gay film if they have the  talent like this film has.
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: A big surprise to me. It's a low budget gay theme film and it's not bad. I enjoyed it very much. Although some of the performances are over the top, they don't spoil the final product. The plot is simple, but funny. Characters aren't thin. The technical side (sound and pictures) is often very poor in this kind of films, but in this case has very good quality.I cannot wait for the european release!
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: I just LOVED this movie!!!  Really GOOD romantic comedies are not that common, and this film is certainly uncommonly funny, in my opinion.  As I watched it, the thought crossed my mind that some reviewers would call much of the movie stereotypical and cliched, but I didn't care!  So what?  The reason stereotypes and cliches exist is because they're true in life so while I'm not calling this movie "real life," it certainly has enough humorous situations and non-offensive funny characters that it kept me laughing out loud practically throughout the film.  I was caught by surprise that the son/nephew had decided to marry a girl to 1) please his family, 2) have children, and 3) avoid being alone in life, but the script writers dealt with that whole plot twist in a remarkably pleasing way, in my opinion.  I was glad that the religious-right (actually wrong, of course) characters were not overly demonized.  They were certainly "put in their place," but it wasn't really harsh and cruel like it could have been in a gay movie.  The movie was so bright, colorful, and filled with such extraordinary detail that I almost felt like I was watching a big budget or big studio film!  Congrats to all involved with this delectable delight of a film creation!  Of course it's NOT real, but what romantic comedy is?  It's not supposed to be!  Just enjoy!
summary: Almost Like a Big Budget Film!
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: The movie is great.  The mother and aunt are the stars of the movie and fun to watch as they stumble into the gay world.  Fun movie, nothing really bad to say about it!
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: This is a very sweet film worthy of your time and your money.  If you enjoy warm, light-hearted comic relief and can forgive a low budget, this film will not disappoint.The scene with mum Mae and Aunt Rose on Manhunt is riotous.  An absolute scream.  I could not stop laughing.  Hilarious stuff."Ok.  Wow.""Look at all of 'em.""It...It's like a catalogue of men."LMAO!!Thank God this film is set in the South because of all the American accents the southern one is my favourite and makes this film an even bigger joy to watch.
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: OMG this is such a funny movie I loved every minute of it, wish I mom woulda been that lady who played his mom
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: If you liked Torchsong Trilogy, To Wong Fu, Priscilla Queen of the Dessert or Broke Back Mountain, then you are in for a big disappointment with this film. To me, it was just moderately funny at best and has no real substance. I guess it's amusing that you could find two totally accepting women living in the Bible Belt, who are just thrilled that their son and nephew is gay, but other than that, it is just too unbelievable and doesn't make much sense.The subject of the story, the young man in question is so lack luster and so far into the closet that he can't seem to find the doorknob, even though his mother and Aunt are doing all they can to help him. And I would think that any Mom and Aunt who have accepted their son and nephew's homosexuality and want to help him, would do a lot better to match him up with a regular guy than try to match him up with a room full of drague Queens and Leather S&M; numbers.The tour of the Gay Cure Clinic was funny, but again, a little over the top. Likewise the drague Queen hitting on the fundamentalist minister was amusing, but pretty unlikely. Unlike Torchsong, To Wong Fu and Priscilla, there is no clever or witty dialogue nor are there any great and memorable one-liners in this movie or any great and universal truths.Over all, the entire movie, to me, is very amateurish and silly; it seems like something that might have been filmed in the 1970's. The mother and aunt seem to have much more fun hanging out with gay counter culture people than the son, who is so boring and uncomfortable with himself and anything gay, that he has already lost his first lover to another young man. It basically presents gay men as silly, vascillating individuals who spend their lives pretending to be women, pretending to be macho men and pretending to be happy. There are no middle of the road, well adjusted gay men in this movie; the kind that a mother or aunt would be happy to accept.
summary: If You Liked Torch Song Trilogy.....
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: What a wonderful story about a mom discovering her son is gay and sets out to find him the perfect mate and in the process develops entourage of gay friends and one hot go go dancer.

Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: I liked this. It was over the top at times, but I think that was the point. Both the mother and aunt characters were easy to love.
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: Very entertaining gay themed "Auntie Mame" type movie. I liked all of the characters, especially the Mom and Aunt.I laughed plenty in this movie. Shades of my early days in San Francisco.
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: When our closeted hero breaks up with his boyfriend, his clueless Southern mother throws a collection of young women at him.  When mom overhears the last in a long line of young women inadvertently out her boy, she starts on a hunt to find him a proper new boyfriend.  Mayhem ensues, culminating in a hysterical dinner party that is a copy of the one in Auntie Mame where Mame is sabotaging her nephew's relationship with his unsuitable girlfriend.  The ending is a little predictable, but the whole movie is so charming, with parts of it being laugh-out-loud funny, that you don't mind.  The characters are believable and engaging and immensely likeable, (well, except for the Bible-thumping bigots but they are hysterically funny.)  Drag queens, go-go boys, leathermen are all part of the delightful mix.  And unlike many of these independent gay comedies, the acting is quite good and reasonably convincing.  This is a charming gay comedy even your straight friends would find funny--well, at least the liberal-minded would!
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: this is a really, really funny movie about a mother who just wants her son to be happy and a son who is gay and afraid to tell Mom who already knows.  And when she finds out, the fun begins.  She wants to find a man for her son!!  FUNNY
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: A cute movie with a great story, and a real twist. I especially loved the mother and her sister. Their characters were clever, and extremely well played. The entire film was a lot of fun.
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: I got this film at a local video rental place.  What I thought I was getting was the foreign film Wild Reeds.  But when I looked inside I saw You Should Meet My Son.  I was disappointed to say the least until I watched the film.Now I've watched with and without the commentary 4 times since last evening and I have just ordered this film from Amazon.  It is truly an amazing little low budget film.There is something so genuine about the story, the characters and the actors.  On top of that, the film is simply FUN. It is hard to imagine Mae and Rose aren't actually sisters.  Their on screen chemistry is amazing.I actually know of similar "fish out of water" experiences that played out in a similar way simply because the people involved are honest and good natured people.  That's what this film is all about.  It is a film where acceptance goes both ways, which is nice for a change.Overall, the story is cute and so much fun.  The acting is good to excellent.  It is so easy to get caught up in the story that any evidence of "low budget" simply isn't noticed.This is now among my favorite top 10 movies.
summary: It is what it is.  And it is FUN FUN FUN
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: It is totally unacceptable for Amazon to have a NO RETURN policy on an item, and not have it POSTED. I have no kindle or anything to watch these movies on. I have not and can not watch this. I will not be forced to buy something else so I can view these 3 movies.  As far as I am concerned Amazon is as bad or worse the eBay, I closed everything I had connected to eBay. And if I have to I will do the same thing with Amazon, then they can shove their store card where the sun don't shine. As for customer service, it should be renamed "WE WILL HELP YOU AFTER YOUR SO PISSED, YOU GIVE UP”  called “so called” customer service 3 time, each time it took 15+ minutes to speak to someone, first time they forwarded me to nowhere, the second time I couldn't hear them and the last time with one csr handing me off to another when the first one disconnected then the second one couldn't hear me.  Amazon would be a great place for an UPGRADE !!!!!!!
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: This is another gay comedy and the more the merrier I say. This is one with a twist though as the central characters are the mother and auntie of our central gay character. He is Brian (Stewart Carrico) and is the only son, of Mae (Joanne McGee). She is a Southern Belle type of mom that Tennessee Williams could have written odes about. She lives with her sister, Aunt Rose (Carol Goans).Their raison d'tre of their entire existence is to get Brian married off to the sweetest little, southern gal and start popping out sweet, little, southern babies. This they do by inviting Brian to dinner and just happening to have also invited an eligible spinster from their wide coterie of friends. Brian always brings his `house mate' Dennis and despite the obvious chemistry between the two men, they just don't get it.Well Dennis finally leaves Brian and discovers his Mr Right. Mother and Auntie then accidentally discover the awful truth that he is - `you know - one of them!' Well after they have gotten used to the idea they decide that they love him just the way he is and set about using their extensive dinner making skills and womanly charms to get him a gay man.Their first port of call is the local gay bar and discorama, which is one of those clubs that has a bit of everything, go go dancer, leather fetish, twinks, drag queens etc. They seem to take to it like a pair of ducks to water and the fun begins.This is a warm comedy and though gay themed there is nothing here that would offend anyone, some cross dressing and no man on man action, as the stars here are the mum and aunt and they really do steal the show especially Joanne McGee who is a tour de force of good intentions - road to hell type woman.Keith Hartman wrote and directed this and it is a brilliant effort. He has managed to get great performances and a good quality production from what was obviously a limited budget as the sound is a bit ropey in places, but that is entirely forgivable. I laughed on a number of occasions and it left me wanting more. So I watched all the extras and there are three excellent short films from Mr Hartman and some `Gratuitous Go Go Boy Footage'. All in all an enjoyable light hearted comedy that deals with all the issues in a caring way but with enough challenges to stop it from getting too schmaltzy. Not the best film ever but I really enjoyed it and hope you will too.
summary: Gay Match Making with Good Ole Southern Hospitality!
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: I have not laughed so much in a long, long time. This was a very well done film - great message, good acting, and interesting story line. I couldn't find this on Netflix and decided to take a chance on purchasing it based on all the great reviews on Amazon. It is definitely worth it!
Title: You Should Meet My Son!

reviewText: This is a great movie.  Mom and her sister figure out son is gay, but don't let him know they know.  His partner (oh...sorry..."best friend") moves on and he is saddened.  So son figures he'll get married to a "real girl", and finds the daughter of a local Baptist minister.  Meanwhile, Mom and her Sister start the search for a partner for the son, and they discover the whole gay scene...including a likely candidate.  The fun really begins when they invite the entire gay entourage to dinner (son doesn't know this) and attempt to introduce their choice of a new partner.  Son brings his fiancé, and that turns the entire dinner into a funny episode.  Mom redo crates the entire house, and hang a painting of a nude George W. Bush above the fireplace (no...really...I'm not kidding) (he was rather well endowed in the painting, but that's another topic for another time). The Baptists and the daughter show up, and the hilarity begins.  I won't tell you the ending...you need to see it for yourself.  Definitely a gay comedy worth watching.
summary: Mom finds a new partner for her son in a hilarious gay comedy
Title: You Should Meet My Son!
